title: No-Bake Chocolate 'Salame'
introduction: Crunchy chocolate nut slices that require no baking are a specialty of Piedmont. These delightful cookies offer a combination of crispness and rich chocolate flavor, enhanced over time as the ingredients meld together. Feel free to experiment by substituting the amaretti cookies with vanilla or chocolate wafers, graham crackers, or shortbread. For those who prefer not to use liqueur, a splash of orange juice works just as well.

instructions.step: Place the cookies in a plastic bag. Crush the cookies with a rolling pin or heavy object. There should be about 3/4 cup of crumbs.
Place the crumbs in a large bowl. With a wooden spoon, stir in the sugar and cocoa. Add the butter and grappa. Stir until the dry ingredients are moistened and blended. Stir in the walnuts.

Place a 14-inch sheet of plastic wrap on a flat surface. Pour the dough mixture onto the plastic wrap. Shape the dough into an 8 × 2 1/2–inch log. Roll the log in the plastic wrap, folding the ends over to enclose it completely. Refrigerate the log at least 24 hours and up to 3 days.
Cut the log into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Serve chilled. Store the cookies in an airtight plastic container in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks.
